description: Iran has held its first parliamentary election since mass 2022 protests over mandatory hijab laws after the death of Mahsa Amini, apparently drawing a low turnout amid calls for a boycott.
title: Iran holds first parliamentary election since mass protests, crackdown

description: "All the talk about the independent No Labels, all that — I haven't talked to anybody about that," Nikki Haley told reporters.
title: Nikki Haley rejects third-party No Labels presidential bid

description: Peter Cichuniec, one of the two former paramedics who were found guilty of criminally negligent homicide in the death of Elijah McClain, was sentenced to five years in prison on Friday.
title: Former Aurora paramedic sentenced to 5 years in death of Elijah McClain

description: The Daily Show host's tearful eulogy to his three-legged dog, Dipper, prompts jump in contributions to Animal Haven a no-kill shelter in New York City.
title: Death of Jon Stewart's dog spurs flood of donations to animal shelter

description: ATF Director Steve Dettelbach discusses the problem of gun violence in America in an interview with "Face the Nation" moderator Margaret Brennan. Their conversation will air on the March 3 broadcast of "Face the Nation."
title: ATF director: "Temperature" on issue of gun violence "way too high"

description: Closing arguments concluded Friday in the hearing to determine if Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis should be removed from former President Donald Trump's Georgia election subversion case. Lawyers for Trump and other defendants argue Willis' romantic relationship with special prosecutor Nathan Wade creates a conflict of interest. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion and legal contributor Jessica Levinson join with analysis.
title: Breaking down closing arguments in Fani Willis misconduct hearing

description: Louisville fighters pulled a female driver out of a semi-cab that crashed into the side of Clark Memorial Bridge and was dangling over the edge.
title: Driver rescued after crashed semi dangles off bridge: "She was praying"

description: Attorney Steve Sadow, who is representing former President Donald Trump in the Georgia election interference case, questioned the timeline of the relationship between Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis and special prosecutor Nathan Wade. The defense team delivered closing arguments in a hearing that could disqualify Willis from prosecuting the case.
title: Trump's attorney questions Fani Willis-Nathan Wade relationship timeline

description: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis arrived at a courtroom after the defense team delivered closing arguments in a hearing that could disqualify her from the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and others. Lawyers for Trump and his co-defendants allege Willis improperly benefited from a romantic relationship with special prosecutor Nathan Wade. Watch Major Garrett anchor CBS News' coverage and a portion of the final arguments delivered by Adam Abbate, the lawyer representing the D.A.'s office.
title: Fani Willis enters courtroom, state makes closing arguments in hearing on alleged misconduct

description: The two largest pharmacy chains in the U.S., CVS and Walgreens, will start selling the abortion pill mifepristone as soon as this month, the companies said Friday. Both companies were certified to dispense the pills following regulatory changes by the FDA. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang reports.
title: CVS, Walgreens to sell mifepristone abortion pills

description: Multiple countries are condemning Israeli forces for firing at Palestinians awaiting delivery of aid in Gaza Thursday. The Israel Defense Forces say many people were killed because they were trampled in a chaotic crush for the aid, and that its troops only fired when they felt endangered by the crowd. But Palestinian health officials say the majority of the deaths were from gunshot wounds. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab is following the calls for an independent investigation.
title: Calls for investigation into Palestinian deaths near Gaza aid convoy

description: The average American homeowner has access to nearly $200,000 in equity. Should you use yours to buy a second home?
title: Can you use your home equity to buy a second home?

description: Thousands of supporters gathered Friday in Moscow outside the funeral service for Russia's most prominent opposition figure, Alexey Navalny. Some mourners present were reportedly arrested by Russian authorities. Putin's long-time foe was murdered in prison on Feb. 16. Mary Ilyushina, a foreign desk reporter for the Washington Post, joins CBS News with the latest.
title: Russians gather to mourn Alexey Navalny

description: 15 states will vote in GOP contests on Super Tuesday, the March 5 campaign date former U.N. ambassador Nikki Haley has been looking forward to in the hopes of obtaining enough delegates to remain competitive with former President Donald Trump. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa reports.
title: Super Tuesday contests next in 2024 presidential election

description: The massive AT&T outage that left more than 1.5 million users without service for hours this month raised the question of how emergency services, usually reached by dialing 911, could be contacted during cellphone outages. Aaron Gregg, a business reporter for the Washington Post, joins CBS News with a look at the options in case of an emergency.
title: How to reach 911 when cell service malfunctions?

description: A new documentary on the life of former talk show host Wendy Williams is being called exploitative in the wake of Williams' aphasia and frontotemporal dementia diagnosis. Aramide Tinubu, a TV critic for Variety, joined CBS News to discuss the show.
title: "Where is Wendy Williams?" documentary sparking intense criticism

description: The measure delays a partial government shutdown for at least another week while Congress tries to agree on long-term funding.
title: Biden signs short-term funding bill to avert government shutdown

description: Some of the biggest wildfires in U.S. history have happened within the last six years.
title: Here are the largest wildfires in U.S.history.

description: Higher interest rates and heavy government spending is leading to ballooning interest payments on the nation's debt.
title: The U.S. is set to pay more on interest on its debt than defense

description: These top-rated cordless vacuums from manufacturers like TK are your best bet for a squeaky clean home.
title: The 5 best cordless vacuums of 2024 make tidying up a breeze

description: John Merchant, a defense attorney representing Michael Roman in the Georgia election interference case, gave his closing arguments Friday in a hearing that could potentially disqualify Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis from prosecuting the case. The defense team alleges that Willis and special prosecutor Nathan Wade had an improper romantic relationship.
title: Defense argues conflict is known "when you see it" in Fani Willis hearing

description: California's Sierra Nevada is already seeing rapid snowfall that's expected to continue overnight and through Saturday morning. High winds could down power lines and trees, and up to 12 feet of snow is expected to fall in some parts of the region. CBS News' Carter Evans reports from Truckee, California.
title: Blizzard slamming California's Sierra Nevada, expected to bring dangerous high winds

description: Former President Donald Trump and his legal team are back in federal court Friday to urge for the Florida trial in the classified documents case to be pushed back until after the 2024 presidential election. CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman is keeping up with the timelines of Trump's cases.
title: Trump asks court to push classified documents trial to after 2024 election

description: Clean your clothing faster and more efficiently with a new on-sale washer and dryer.
title: These massive deals on washers and dryers will kick start your spring cleaning

description: The announcement comes after Israeli forces fired this week on Palestinians who were waiting for desperately needed aid.
title: Biden says U.S. will airdrop humanitarian aid to Gaza

description: Michigan is the latest state to see a case of measles, according to the CDC's tally.
title: What we know about the 41 measles cases reported across the U.S. in 2024

description: If you're wondering whether long-term care insurance is worth the cost of the premiums, here's what to know.

description: You have lots of good options for adding gold to your 401(k), whether you're a novice or a seasoned investor.

description: The new recommendations apply to COVID-19 and other viruses, like flu and RSV.
title: CDC shortens 5-day COVID isolation, updates guidance on masks, testing

description: Closing arguments will begin Friday in a hearing over whether to disqualify Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis and her office from prosecuting the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and several co-defendants. CBS News legal contributor Rikki Klieman breaks down the case.
title: Closing arguments to start in bid to remove Fani Willis from Trump Georgia case

description: Republican strategist Leslie Sanchez and Democratic strategist Joel Payne joined CBS News to discuss the biggest stories in politics this week, including President Biden and former President Donald Trump's separate trips to the southern border and the Michigan primary.
title: Political strategists on Biden and Trump border visits, protest vote against president

description: Princess Kate hasn't been seen in public since Christmas and now the internet is full of speculation about where she is. Last month, Kensington Palace announced she underwent a "planned abdominal surgery" and Thursday a spokesperson for the princess doubled down on the decision to only provide significant updates. CBS News royal contributor Amanda Foreman has more.
title: Rumors swirling over Princess Kate's whereabouts after months without public appearance

description: The Texas Panhandle wildfires have left cattle with "hooves burned off" and many of those that survived are now in need of nebulizer treatments and other  care.
title: Texas Panhandle wildfires are leaving "dead animals everywhere"

description: If you're gamer, to see and experience your games in the best possible way, you need one of the best gaming monitors.
title: The 6 best gaming monitors for 2024, including one under $800

description: "Even sophisticated investors can be conned by fraudsters, especially when personal relationships and networks are used," the New York AG said.
title: Harvard Business School grad accused of targeting his own in Ponzi scheme

description: House Republicans demanded information from the FBI about a confidential source now charged with fabricating bribery allegations against the president and his son.
title: GOP chairs demand info about FBI informant charged with lying about Bidens

description: You can really clean up with these spring cleaning deals on Dyson vacuums and air purifiers.

title: 20 best high-yield savings accounts to open in March

description: In January, the FDA changed regulations to allow retail pharmacies to sell the drug mifepristone.
title: CVS and Walgreens to start selling abortion pills this month

description: Alabama's House and Senate have both passed bills protecting doctors and clinics that perform IVF, but the legislation does not address the recent ruling that frozen embryos have the same rights as children, effectively ending IVF treatments in the state. CBS News campaign reporter Shawna Mizelle has more.
title: Alabama lawmakers move to protect IVF clinics, providers

description: "Bachelor" star​ Joey Graziadei revealed on social media that the "yellow eyes" some commenters noticed are due to Gilbert syndrome, a liver disorder. Here's what to know.
title: What is Gilbert Syndrome? "Bachelor" star reveals reason for "yellow eyes"

description: Russians lined up around a Moscow church to pay respects to Alexey Navalny at a funeral service for the opposition leader. There was also a large police presence. CBS News foreign correspondent Ramy Inocencio has more.
title: Heavy police presence at Alexey Navalny funeral

description: President Biden, former President Donald Trump and former U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Nikki Haley will have a much clearer picture of their futures after next week's Super Tuesday, when 15 states and one territory will hit the primary polls. CBS News politics reporter Zak Hudak has more.
title: Biden facing more protest votes, Haley on last legs against Trump with Super Tuesday next week

description: Discover the eight best electric dryers in 2024 from brands like Samsung, LG, GE and Whirlpool.
title: The 8 best electric dryers for 2024

description: There are various ways for savers to grow their CD returns this month. Here are three to know.
title: 3 great ways to boost your CD returns this March

description: Former president and CEO, Thomas Cangemi, abruptly stepped down after 27 years at the regional bank, which disclosed "material weaknesses" tied to loans.
title: New York Community Bancorp shares plummet as CEO exits amid loan woes

description: The National Urban League report's findings suggest that Black Americans earn significantly less than White people, with a median family income of $45,000 compared to $75,000 for Whites.
title: New report  finds continued economic disparities among Black Americans

description: A Georgia judge will hear closing arguments over removing Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis from the case against former President Donald Trump and others.
title: Judge to hear closing arguments over removing Fani Willis from Trump case

description: Jennifer Dulos was reported missing in May 2019 after dropping her kids off at school in New Canaan, Connecticut.
title: Michelle Troconis found guilty in Jennifer Dulos' disappearance

description: Spring is just around the corner. Here's how a debt relief service could help with your financial spring cleaning.
title: How debt relief services can help with financial spring cleaning

description: President Biden and former President Donald Trump took separate trips to the southern border Thursday with wildly different messages. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden calls for compromise on immigration, Trump blames Biden for crisis

description: "Dune: Part Two," the highly-anticipated sequel to 2021's "Dune," is now in theaters and so far it's getting rave reviews and making a strong start at the box office. Erik Davis, managing editor for Fandango, joined CBS News to discuss the movie.
title: "Dune: Part Two" getting impressive reviews, box office performance

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, actor and entrepreneur Gabrielle Union along with her business partner tell us all about their hair care line.Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: The National Urban League's 2024 "State of Black America" report highlights the ongoing struggle for equality. The report reveals a significant gap, with Black Americans scoring just under 76% towards achieving full equality with their white counterparts. Marc Morial, president of the National Urban League, joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the findings.
title: National Urban League President Marc Morial talks "State of Black America" report

description: These deals won't last long.
title: CBS Mornings Deals: Save 50% on an external hard drive

description: Toyota warns that loose parts on some Tacoma trucks could cause the rear axle to break apart, increasing the risk of a crash.
title: Toyota recalls 381,000 Tacoma trucks over potential rear-axle defect

description: President Biden and former President Trump made separate visits to the southern border Thursday with Biden calling on Trump to work with him toward a solution to the immigration crisis. CBS News immigration reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez has more.
title: How voters are responding to Biden, Trump border visits

description: The tech-centric NASDAQ is closing at a new high, driven by enthusiasm for artificial intelligence. This milestone marks its first record peak since 2021.
title: Stock market soars to record highs, fueled by AI optimism

description: Record-breaking snowfall and ferocious winds are anticipated in the Sierra Nevada mountains of California as a dangerous blizzard blows through the state. CBS News correspondent Carter Evans has more.
title: Up to 12 feet of snow, 100 mph winds predicted in California's Sierra Nevada

description: Kevin Monahan, 66, was previously convicted of second-degree murder in the death of Kaylin Gillis.
title: Man who killed woman after driveway mistake gets 25 years in prison

description: Assistant Director David Halls broke down in tears while recounting the moments after the gunshot rang out, killing cinematographer Halyna Hutchins.
title: "Rust" assistant director gives emotional testimony about fatal shooting

description: A funeral was held Friday for Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny, who died in February at an Arctic prison. Russia reporter Mary Ilyushina joined CBS News with more.
title: Funeral held for Alexey Navalny in Moscow

description: The Menendez brothers are serving life sentences for killing their parents in 1989. Now, they're hoping new evidence will help them in their fight for freedom. "48 Hours" contributor Natalie Morales reports.
title: Menendez brothers hope new evidence will help reopen infamous murder case

description: Weight Watchers saw its shares plummet by 18% following the announcement that Oprah Winfrey is stepping down from its board of directors, marking the end of her long-standing association with the brand
title: WeightWatchers shares tumble as Oprah Winfrey exits board

description: Tanya Hill Holliday started out at a McDonald's in Baltimore, Maryland before going on to run 12 franchises in Pennsylvania.
title: She started scrubbing toilets at McDonald's - now she owns 12 locations on the Main Line

description: "It just goes to highlight the value of these surveys and serves as a reminder of the ocean's boundless unexplored secrets, even in areas we consider well-charted and studied," one scientist said.
title: New sea slug species found in the waters off the U.K.

description: Scott Pelley reports on the battle to ban 97 books in one South Carolina public school district and the role played by the national movement for “parental rights” inspired by a group called Moms for Liberty. Sunday on 60 Minutes.
title: 97 Books I Sunday on 60 Minutes

description: Israel is defending itself against Palestinian allegations that its troops intentionally attacked people waiting for aid. The Hamas-run Health Ministry in Gaza says more than 100 people were killed when refugees swarmed a food convoy in Gaza, and Israeli soldiers opened fire. As Imtiaz Tyab reports, the Israelis say they were in danger.
title: Israel responds to allegations after deadly aid convoy incident

description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the 2023 News & Documentary Emmy-winner for Outstanding Recorded News Program, hosted by Jane Pauley.
title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (March 3)

description: Lawsuit accuses OpenAI of abandoning its mission to benefit humanity in favor of pursuing its commercial interests.
title: Elon Musk sues OpenAI and Sam Altman, claiming "stark betrayal"

description: Former President Donald Trump is attending a hearing in Florida Friday where a judge will consider when his classified documents case will go to trial. Meanwhile, in Georgia, closing arguments are expected in a hearing over whether Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis and her office can continue to prosecute the election interference case against Trump. Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
title: Trump criminal cases have pivotal hearings in Georgia and Florida

description: A severe winter storm has begun bringing copious amounts of snow to California's Sierra Nevada this week. Extremely dangerous mountain travel is expected, with long stretches of roadway becoming impassible with blizzard conditions.
title: Northern California braces for snow storm with Blizzard Warnings in effect. Here's the forecast.

description: Two of Donald Trump's criminal cases will have impactful hearings Friday. In Florida, a judge will consider the trial date in the former president's classified documents case. And in Georgia, closing arguments are beginning over whether Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis should be disqualified from the state's election interference case against Trump. CBS News legal contributor Rebecca Roiphe has more.
title: 2 Trump cases reach crossroads: What to know

description: The funeral of Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny took place in Moscow after authorities released his body to his family just hours before. In Russia, publicly mourning Navalny is a bold act of resistance, yet large crowds have bravely gathered in the streets, facing the threat of arrest or worse.
title: Funeral held for Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny

description: Border policy is front and center as President Biden and former President Trump visited Texas on Thursday. They both held events 300 miles apart as each tried to persuade voters to support their immigration policies.
title: Biden and Trump hold competing Texas border events

description: Texas battles its largest wildfire ever, while a massive blizzard could bring up to 12 feet of snow in California. Also, Alexey Navalny's funeral is held in Moscow amid tight government security, with mourners facing possible arrest. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Texas battles its largest wildfire ever while California prepares for massive blizzard

description: The Federal Reserve is set to meet again on March 19. Should homebuyers lock in a mortgage rate before then?
title: Should you lock in a mortgage rate before the Fed's March meeting?

description: Check out these great kitchen islands and kitchen carts from Wayfair, Urban Outfitters, Anthropologie and more.
title: Best kitchen islands and kitchen carts in 2024

description: Alabama lawmakers are urgently working to safeguard in-vitro fertilization practices following a court decision that challenges the treatment's legality in the state. A new two-page bill aims to offer legal protection to IVF patients, doctors, and clinics, yet fails to tackle the Alabama Supreme Court's controversial ruling granting embryos the same legal rights as children.
title: Alabama lawmakers work to safeguard IVF practices

description: In Texas, firefighters are working around the clock in a desperate attempt to control massive wildfires that have already claimed two lives in the panhandle.
title: Firefighters battle to contain deadly Texas blazes

description: In California, up to 12 feet of snow could fall over the weekend in the Sierra Nevada, which is under a rare blizzard warning today. Meanwhile, Texas is struggling to contain deadly wildfires, including the largest the state has ever seen.
title: Up to 12 feet of snow expected in California's Sierra Nevada amid rare blizzard warning

description: Lyle and Erik Menendez claim new evidence proves the brothers' longstanding claim that they killed their parents in self-defense.
title: Will new evidence free the Menendez brothers?

description: "That's magnificent," said Bill Whitaker as he watched wild wolves in Yellowstone National Park in 2018. Wolves were eradicated in the American West until the endangered species was reintroduced in the 1990s, and their return led both to controversy and to unforeseen and positive impacts.
title: The wolves of Yellowstone | 60 Minutes Archive

description: Sam's Club is offering yearly memberships for $25 ahead of spring. Here's how to score the deal.
title: Sam's Club has a March deal for new members: Join for 50% off

description: As of mid-February, at least 15 states have reported measles cases and multiple ongoing, uncontained outbreaks.
title: Measles can be deadly and is highly contagious — but it is preventable

description: The judge called the abuse "the most extensive and persistent evil" he has ever seen.
title: Couple gets over 150 years in prison for "indescribable" torture of sons

description: As well-wishers flocked to a Moscow church for Alexey Navalny's funeral, Russian authorities warned people against any "unauthorized gatherings"
title: Crowds gather for Navalny's funeral despite tight security in Moscow

description: The judge in the classified documents case against Trump may indicate when the trial will take place.
title: Trump, special counsel back in federal court in classified documents case

description: A growing number of nations are condemning Israel over a deadly encounter between IDF soldiers and Palestinians in Gaza City.
title: Israel faces mounting backlash over civilians killed in Gaza incident

description: Haitian gang leader Jimmy "Barbeque" Cherisier has announced a coordinated attack to oust Prime Minister Ariel Henry.
title: Haitian gangs launch coordinated attack, vow to oust prime minister

description: A 29-year-old suspect was captured following a manhunt, police said.
title: One killed, 2 wounded in shooting in dental office near San Diego

description: Biden, Trump make dueling visits to southern border; Oklahoma centenarian celebrates leap day birthday
title: 2/29: CBS Evening News

description: Winnie Greco, a former fundraiser for Adams who now serves as his director of Asian affairs, was placed on administrative leave.
title: FBI raids 2 homes belonging to aide of New York City Mayor Eric Adams

description: John Dickerson reports on dueling visits to the southern border by President Biden and former President Trump, a record-breaking fire in Texas, and lawmakers in Alabama passing bills to protect IVC clinics.
title: 2/29: Prime Time with John Dickerson

description: A federal judge has held veteran investigative reporter Catherine Herridge in civil contempt for refusing to divulge her source for a series of Fox News stories about a Chinese American scientist who was investigated by the FBI but never charged.
title: Judge holds journalist Catherine Herridge in contempt for refusing to divulge source

description: Astronomers have discovered three small moons at the farthest planets of our solar system — two circling Neptune and one around Uranus.
title: Astronomers discover 3 tiny moons orbiting Uranus and Neptune

description: For many Americans, a college degree is seen as the key to professional success and economic mobility. However, a new study shows that promise does not hold for some graduates. Vanessa Fuhrmans, deputy chief for the Wall Street Journal's careers and workplace bureau, joins CBS News to discuss the high percentage of post-grad underemployment.
title: Roughly half of graduates are underemployed 10 years after college, study finds

description: Homes and businesses have been destroyed and thousands of cattle are likely dead as the massive Smokehouse Creek Fire continues to spread in the Texas Panhandle, surpassing one million acres in size. An 83-year-old grandmother was killed in the blaze. Dave Malkoff has the latest.
title: Largest wildfire in Texas history burns over 1 million acres

description: By law, hospitals are required to put their prices online. But many aren't fully complying, and it's costing people money. CBS News consumer investigative correspondent Anna Werner has more on these "hidden costs."
title: Many hospitals defy price transparency rules, report finds

description: More than 100 people are dead after a violent scene Thursday beside an aid truck in northern Gaza. Jon Alterman, senior vice president at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins CBS News to examine what the incident means for getting additional aid to the territory, and for the likelihood of a cease-fire deal.
title: Biden says Gaza aid convoy deaths will complicate cease-fire efforts

description: In a since-deleted post on the dark web, a Russian-speaking ransomware group claimed responsibility, alleging they stole more than six terabytes of data.
title: Cyberattack on UnitedHealth impacts prescription access

description: A wildfire in the Texas Panhandle has expanded to more than one million acres, becoming the largest blaze in state history. CBS News correspondent Dave Malkoff has the latest.
title: Texas Panhandle wildfire only 3% contained as it breaks records

description: President Biden and former President Donald Trump both made trips to the southern border Thursday. The visits come as Americans increasingly point to immigration as a top issue ahead of the November election. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe and Camilo Montoya-Galvez report.
title: Biden, Trump offer contrasting immigration policies at southern border

description: Typically, FAFSA forms are released on Oct. 1. But this year, the application forms came out three months late, on Dec. 30, 2023.
title: Glitches with new FAFSA form leave prospective college students in limbo

description: Mary Lea Forsythe of Oklahoma turned 100 Thursday. Born on Feb. 29, 1924, she is a rare leap year baby, as Thursday "actually" marks her 25th birthday.
title: Oklahoma centenarian celebrates leap day birthday

description: Originally slated for a theatrical release last July, "Coyote vs. Acme" was reportedly shelved by Warner Bros. Discovery in November.
title: Actor Will Forte says "Coyote vs. Acme" film likely never coming out

description: Computer glitches to the U.S. Department of Education's overhaul of the FAFSA form has led to a botched rollout that has forced colleges across the country to push their financial aid deadlines. It's also left many students in the lurch. Meg Oliver explains.
title: Glitches with new FAFSA form leave prospective college students in limbo

description: Iowa basketball star Caitlin Clark, who is just 18 points away from breaking Pete Maravich's NCAA all-time scoring record, announced Thursday she will forgo a fifth year in college and enter the WNBA draft.
title: Iowa star Caitlin Clark to enter WNBA draft

description: Oprah Winfrey announced Thursday she is stepping down from the board of directors for WeightWatchers. She has been on the board since 2015, when she acquired a 10% stake in the company. Nikki Battiste has more.
title: Oprah steps down from WeightWatchers' board of directors

description: A cyberattack on the health technology provider Change Healthcare, a subsidiary of the UnitedHealth Group, is wreaking havoc nationwide, as some hospitals and pharmacies cannot get paid and many patients are unable to get prescriptions. Nicole Sganga has details.
title: Cyberattack on UnitedHealth still impacting prescription access

description: Eyewitnesses told CBS News that Israeli forces Thursday opened fire on people in Gaza City who were gathered around food aid trucks. The Hamas-run Gaza Health Ministry says that at least 100 people were killed. Imtiaz Tyab reports from Israel.
title: Israeli forces accused of opening fire on civilians in Gaza

description: President Biden was in Brownsville, Texas, on Thursday, where he asked former President Donald Trump to join him in pressing House Republicans to pass the Senate's bipartisan border security bill. Trump, meanwhile, was in Eagle Pass, where took a much different approach, unleashing attacks on Mr. Biden, Democrats and migrants. Ed O'Keefe has the latest.
title: Biden, Trump make dueling visits to southern border

description: Despite the dangers, many migrants are now choosing routes through California rather than crossing at the Texas border. U.S. Customs and Border Protection's San Diego Sector saw nearly 25,000 illegal crossings in January alone. Adam Yamaguchi reports.
title: Migrant crossings shift toward California

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Thursday, February 29, 2024

description: Tyler McCain recalls the moment his family of five arrived at their home in Fritch, Texas, only to find it completely gone. "It's scary to think that the rest of your whole entire life can be affected by something that happened in a day."
title: Smokehouse Creek Fire destroys Texas family's home: "A new fear that has been unlocked"
